title: Billboard Charts Analysis
text:
charts %>%
  arrange(desc(`weeks-on-board`)) %>%
  slice_max(`weeks-on-board`, n = 10) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(song, `weeks-on-board`), y = `weeks-on-board`, fill = artist)) +
  geom_col() +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(title = "Top 10 Songs by Weeks on Chart",
       x = "Song", y = "Weeks on Chart",
       caption = "This chart shows the top 10 songs by weeks on the chart, ordered from highest to lowest. Each bar represents the number of weeks a song has spent on the chart, with colors indicating the artist.") +
  theme_minimal()

title: Billie Eilish: Interactive Chart Analysis
text:
library(plotly)
p3 <- ggplot(billie, aes(x = song, y = rank, fill = song)) +
  geom_boxplot(show.legend = FALSE) +
  scale_y_reverse() +
  labs(title = "Billie Eilish: Rank Distribution by Song",
       x = "Song", y = "Rank") +
  theme_minimal()

ggplotly(p3)
